titleStmt.title: Saint Petersburg, The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка), Marcel 121

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

msIdentifier.repository: The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка) , Saint Petersburg

summary.p: 50 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 121; Qurʾānic Text: Q 9:37-10:34; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 185 x 118mm; Script style: kūfī D.I.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 121
50 fol. 118×185 mm (1.57). Support: thin transparent parchment, rigid, darkish, of yellowish color. Writing material: dark brown and black ink.
Collation: five full quinions.
I: H1F H2F H3F S H4F H5F / F6H F7H F8H S F9H F10H (fol. 1 and 10, 2 and 9, 4 and 7, 5 and 6 are bifolia, the rest are singletons with stubs);
II: H11F H12F H13F S H14F H15F / F16H F17H F18H S F19H F20H (fol. 11 and 20, 12 and 19, 14 and 17, 15 and 16 are bifolia, the rest two are singletons with stubs);
III: H21F H22F H23F H24F S H25F H26F / F27H F28H S F29H F30H S F31H S (fol. 23 and 30, 25 and 28, 26 and 27 are bifolia, fol. 21, 22, 24, 29, 31 are singletons with stubs);
IV: H32F H33F H34F S H35F H36F / F37H F38H F39H S F40H F41H (fol. 32 and 41, 33 and 40, 35 and 38, 36 and 37 are bifolia, fol. 34, 39 are singletons with stubs);
V: H42F H43F H44F S H45F H46F / F47H S F48H S F49H F150H (fol. 42 and 50, 43 and 49, 46 and 47 are bifolia, fol. 44, 45, 48 are singletons with stubs).
Text layout: 67×120 mm (1.777), 7 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: →D I, rather small. Diacritics: absent (with rare exceptions on fol. 10v, 15r). Vocalization: round red dots.

Verse markers: for groups of five verses – golden letter ﻪ (hā); for groups of ten verses – medallions in the text line (types 2''''.A.II, 1.A.I и 1.B.I), in gold and colors (fol. 1v, 5v, 8v, 12v, 17r, 20v, 25v, 29v, 33v, 37v, 41r, 45r, 49v).
The title of surah 10 (يونس ماية و تسع آيات) is written in gold (fol. 37v).
Stitching: thick threads have been preserved in the punctures of all the quires; traces of brown substance (leather of the spine?) on the outer folds of the quire.
Traces of old conservation: text on the flesh side of many sheets has been renewed with black ink; these pages are marked with a small circle in the upper outer corner.
Inscriptions: numbers of surahs in Roman numerals and the verse numbers in Arabic numerals are inscribed in pencil in the upper outer corner of most sheets, on recto and/or verso sides.
Defects: minor stains on the pages; ink has partly peeled off on the flesh sides.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with the letters “CA”, brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink “50 f. 7 lig. \ IX S. v. 38 à fin \ X - v. 1 à 35” and old accession number in red pencil “B. 81”.
Old accession numbers: CA (on the wrapping), B. 81 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–37v. Surah 9, verses 37(37)–130(129)*. Incipit: [لا يهوي القو]مَ الكافرون.
Fol. 37v–50v. Surah 10, verses 1(1)–35(34). Explicit: قلْ اللهُ يبدأ ا[لخلقَ]."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
